intro: Erythraea variabilis, commonly known as the variable erythraea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Erythraea variabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
